title: Give Everyone Access Before You Know What Works
insight: For general-purpose AI tools, universal access surfaces use cases that pilots miss. You can't predict which teams will find breakthrough applications. Cast wide, then concentrate resources on what emerges.
manifestations: P&G: Rejected pilot model, 8,000 requests in first 2 hours, company-wide in months
Commonwealth Bank: 50,000 employees got ChatGPT Enterprise access on day one (largest global deployment)
Moderna: 80%+ employee adoption of mChat, 750+ custom GPTs emerged organically
Contrast with narrow pilots that throttle organizational learning
test: Are you learning from 50 users or 50,000? If you're still in 'pilot' for general-purpose tools, you're throttling organizational learning.
whenNotToUse: Custom AI for specific high-stakes workflows (drug discovery, trading algorithms) where you need to understand the full system before scaling.
